content:
# Factorio Report

## EXISTING STRUCTURES

### First furnace at position (0.0, 0.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Stone furnace (position 0.0, 0.0) with coal as fuel and capable of producing iron plates.

### Additional furnaces
Consists of the following entities:
- Stone furnace (position 2.0, 0.0) with coal as fuel, currently has no ingredients to smelt.
- Stone furnace (position 4.0, 0.0) with coal as fuel, currently has no ingredients to smelt.
- Stone furnace (position 6.0, 0.0) with coal as fuel, currently has no ingredients to smelt.

### Wooden chest at position (8.5, 0.5)
Consists of the following entities:
- Wooden chest (position 8.5, 0.5) with an empty inventory.

## ERROR TIPS

### Errors when inserting items into the furnace
- Ensure you have the required items in your inventory before attempting to insert them into the furnace. For example, the error "Could not insert: No iron-ore to insert from your inventory" indicates that there was no iron ore available.

### Errors when adding coal to the furnace
- Check the inventory capacity of the furnace before adding coal. The error "Failed to insert coal into stone-furnace (type furnace) at position {x = 0, y = 0}. Inventory is full" suggests that the furnace's fuel inventory is full, preventing additional coal from being added.

### Repeated errors when inserting coal
- This error occurs frequently when trying to add coal to the first furnace. Ensure to monitor the fuel levels in the furnace and avoid adding coal when the inventory is already full.

### Errors when extracting items from the furnace
- Ensure that the furnace has produced items before attempting to extract them. If the furnace is empty, you will not be able to extract any items.

### General inventory management
- Keep track of your inventory space to avoid errors related to full inventory when trying to insert items into structures.
